All scanned copies should be attached to the expense report: eTicket receipt with price reflected; boarding passes; train, bus/shuttle bus tickets; hotel invoice (and the receipt in case the Employee paid for the hotel by his/her corporate credit card); receipts for car rental, fuel, parking, taxi, visa expenses, insurance, etc.\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"For some projects, collecting receipts for meals is required. The only cases when a hotel bill might not be available are:\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"i. Customer is paying for the accommodations.\\nii. Accommodations where booked online (e.g. through Expedia.com, Hotels.com, etc.).\\niii. When the Employee leaves the accommodations at a time when reception is normally closed, the bill should be arranged the night before the departure, if possible. If not, it is the travelling Employee's responsibility to arrange a copy of the bill to be faxed to the office as soon as possible. A failure to obtain a hotel bill could result in the expense report being rejected.
